publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2371 Ms Wendy Alexander: Firefighters’ Dispute at Glasgow Airport—That the Parliament notes with concern the firefighters’ dispute at Glasgow International Airport which has led to fire cover currently not being provided by the in-house team; regrets that the strikers have been taken to the Court of Session for engaging in peaceful picketing, and urges both sides to get back around the table and secure a resolution to this dispute that does not compromise public safety. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray*, Maureen Macmillan*, Bill Butler*, Elaine Smith*, Richard Baker*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Jackie Baillie*, Trish Godman*, Mr Duncan McNeil*, Mike Watson*

S2M-2371 Ms Wendy Alexander: Firefighters’ Dispute at Glasgow Airport—That the Parliament notes with concern the firefighters’ dispute at Glasgow International Airport which has led to fire cover currently not being provided by the in-house team; regrets that the strikers have been taken to the Court of Session for engaging in peaceful picketing, and urges both sides to get back around the table and secure a resolution to this dispute that does not compromise public safety. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Bill Butler, Elaine Smith, Richard Baker, Mr Frank McAveety, Jackie Baillie, Trish Godman, Mr Duncan McNeil, Mike Watson, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Sarah Boyack*, Helen Eadie*, Kate Maclean*, Margaret Jamieson*, Bristow Muldoon*
S2M-2371 Firefighters’ Dispute at Glasgow Airport (lodged on 3 February 2005) Cathie Craigie*, Christine May*
S2M-2371 Firefighters’ Dispute at Glasgow Airport (lodged on 3 February 2005) Michael McMahon*
S2M-2371 Firefighters’ Dispute at Glasgow Airport (lodged on 3 February 2005) Karen Gillon*
S2M-2371 Firefighters’ Dispute at Glasgow Airport (lodged on 3 February 2005) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-2371 Firefighters’ Dispute at Glasgow Airport (lodged on 3 February 2005) Cathy Peattie*
